title: Miloš Mihajlov
text:
Miloš Mihajlov (; born 15 December 1982) is a <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>n former professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>.
Career.
Born in <a href="Belgrade">Belgrade</a>, Mihajlov started out at <a href="FK%20Vo%C5%BEdovac">Voždovac</a>. He helped the Dragons win the <a href="Serbian%20League%20Belgrade">Serbian League Belgrade</a> in the 2003–04 season and gain promotion to the <a href="2004%E2%80%9305%20Serbian%20Second%20League">2004–05 Serbian Second League</a>. Following the club's merger with <a href="FK%20%C5%BDeleznik">Železnik</a>, Mihajlov made his debut in the top flight during the 2005–06 campaign.
In June 2006, Mihajlov signed a four-year contract with <a href="FK%20Partizan">Partizan</a>. He scored the opening goal in the <a href="Eternal%20derby%20%28Serbia%29">Belgrade derby</a> on 24 February 2007, heading in <a href="Marko%20Lomi%C4%87">Marko Lomić</a>'s corner kick, as Partizan won the game 4–2. In January 2008, Mihajlov moved to Turkish club <a href="Konyaspor">Konyaspor</a>. He subsequently played for Romanian club <a href="FC%20Politehnica%20Ia%C8%99i%20%281945%29">Politehnica Iași</a> and Chinese club <a href="Changchun%20Yatai%20F.C.">Changchun Yatai</a>.
In 2011, Mihajlov moved to Kazakhstan, staying there for the next two seasons with <a href="FC%20Zhetysu">Zhetysu</a>. He also played for Norwegian club <a href="Sandnes%20Ulf">Sandnes Ulf</a> in 2013. In January 2014, Mihajlov returned to Serbia and signed for his former club <a href="FK%20Vo%C5%BEdovac">Voždovac</a>.
In February 2015, Mihajlov rejoined <a href="FC%20Zhetysu">Zhetysu</a>. He spent only six months there, before again returning to <a href="FK%20Vo%C5%BEdovac">Voždovac</a>.
